instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
threads.message: This is a weird issue, board had corrosion around <TRANSISTOR>Q8131</TRANSISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R8131</RESISTOR>, that all got fixed but the board still does the same: Turns on all the way for about 10 seconds, shutsdown then starts up again and stays on VCORE is 1.8v at this point, but there is no USB activity, already tried clean BIOS and reflow SMC and same thing.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> stays high?
Possibly corrosion underneath PCH/CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  0v

I just ran it thru the UC and oven to remove corrosion if any, same behavior

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
threads.message:
PCH issue.
Possibly crap accumulated underneath.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
threads.message: Cleaned glue around CPU, put 559 flux and ran it via the ZaoMao reballing machine and same exact behavior.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots but no USB activity
threads.message:
Sometime is a sign of SMC failure, or bad solders.
You can try soldering pins 5/6 together and check if pin 3 goes high.
